title: Champion personalities
body:
Kind of a game,
we all know that vayne riven and has are normally salty in-game so I am wondering what weird champions you find to generally be chill, 
For me it's shen and gnar but I might be biased about shen since I main him?

replies.body: {{champion:33}}  mains are okay.
OK
OK
{{champion:14}}'s are actually pretty nice guys.
https://youtu.be/1mHt7WlEyuY?t=65
https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=bZa_Q8qXUSU#
we are simple people, we just get all nice and wet and COOOOOOOOWAAAARDS
{{champion:119}} His ego is larger than my future.

{{champion:103}} are nice, especially arcade ones. If you're laning against them and dance, it's very likely they're gonna dance back :U

{{champion:267}} players always seem to care about the whole team and are like this giant mother that speeds up everyone

{{champion:201}} same as nami
I like dancing  but I only have academy ahri
Tbh im the saltiest fishstick you'll meet if this is true lmao. I try not to be

> [{quoted}](name=ChromaSpell,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=HzxwENuy,comment-id=0006,timestamp=2017-01-03T01:14:48.514+0000)
>
> {{champion:103}} are nice, especially arcade ones. If you're laning against them and dance, it's very likely they're gonna dance back :U
> 

^ THIS YES!

{{champion:432}}
Edit: {{champion:27}}  Just try tilting one of these guys.
I dunno, half the bard players are super chill and the others rage everyone to hell
Yeah, normally I would have said Bard, but I litterally just got out of a game with one of the most enraged players I've seen in a long time.
bard just glides through the chaos with a straight face, collecting chimes XD

{{champion:427}}  are evil, end of story 
_side note, stop saying im trolling when i first item {{item:3107}}  as jg ivern :( _
Singed players are sadistic bastards
lulu's are usually p cool
I find that they're a bit more... purple.
http://i.imgur.com/iyu9UQ4.gif?noredirect
{{champion:134}} mains, well at least before she was a flavor of the month champ.
I am ashamed to say I mained Syndra in season 4, when she was better than she is now.
Yeah, thats how I got into her, but i kept playing her through S7 even when she was kinda shit, just a really cool champ to me.
{{champion:238}} players are like those cool kids that do a kick flip in front of their friends and make it seem like they jumped the Grand Canyon.
Most Zeds I know are the kind of people who say "Sure, I'll catch you" during a trust exercise but drop you cuz they were too busy flexing at some girls out the window.

{{champion:157}} 
These guys vary from the ff:
- Will feed 2-3 kills then quit
- Really bad at mechanics
- Really Salty and toxic
- Decent, friendly and open to talk to.

I'm the fourth kind.
I call your bluff and raise you one ekko

If you don't use High Noon Yasuo, I don't believe you.

######The only friendly Yasuos play the harmonica...

> [{quoted}](name=AbsorbantTNT,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=HzxwENuy,comment-id=000a0001,timestamp=2017-01-03T19:07:37.926+0000)
>
> If you don't use High Noon Yasuo, I don't believe you.
> 
> ######The only friendly Yasuos play the harmonica...

I don't even own a skin for Yasuo. I only have a Mastery Level 7 emote.

Okay, well similar to Shockblade Zed, using the release skin on a champion that most people don't like usually indicates that you were playing them when they first came out and are not necessarily a jerk.

So if you do get a skin for Yasuo, get High Noon. Most people overlook it for other skins, but it's actually pretty cool. I know that if I ever played Yasuo, I would get it.
High Noon is the only Yasuo skin I have.  .3.
{{champion:17}} :go go gadget kill yourself
{{sticker:zombie-nunu-bummed}}

I've met a lot of mean teemo mains
_A LOT_

But I just pretend to main teemo
:(

I don't pretend to wipe the floors with teemo
https://i.imgflip.com/1gzscg.jpg

Taric.  Not saying that because I am a Taric main, but because I try to be the epitome of one.  I literally mained Taric because he made people laugh.  When a champion makes people laugh and you are always playing that champion you can't help but laugh.

Only salty Tarics I have ever met were ones who got him in ARAM on free week.  Never met a Taric player who was salty.

{{champion:111}} The chances of them making a pun are naut low

{{champion:9}} All they want to do is surprise ult, they don't care if they win or lose, just make the other team shit themselves

{{champion:20}} pretty chill, even more so when they have the Nunu Bot skin, they are too busy hitting the laugh hot-key to spam chat with toxicity
ikr, the fiddle one is so true XD
{{champion:202}} mains tend to be pretty chill, if a little theatrical.

{{champion:131}}  Rarely seen, but most every Diana player I have ever met seem to be pretty chill. They usually don't talk much though. Her kit isn't very flashy so the GG 1v1 me scrub people don't play her really.
There's a Diana main that frequents the boards, you may know them as Heretic Lunari.
yeah, dianas a rather silent, i used to play her

{{champion:39}}  Generally nice people, but can be bitchy/salty if you piss them off xD..


Source: Me

> [{quoted}](name=Cap7ain Teem0,realm=NA,application-id=Ir7ZrJjF,discussion-id=HzxwENuy,comment-id=,timestamp=2017-01-03T00:07:34.588+0000)
>
> For me it&#039;s shen and gnar but I might be biased about shen since I main him?

Uh oh, I have mastery 7 Riven and Gnar what does that mean?
Well generally the as whole rivers are mastery 3-4 and after that they seem to chill out
I've seen lots of Rivens use their mastery to BM nonstop though, maybe I've just gone against toxic ones.

{{champion:78}} mains are the scum of the Earth. They are unreasonable, barbaric scoundrels that plague this game like a disease. When not enraged, they are reveling in the pure misery of others. Without fail, I make sure to ban Poppy every game for everyone's sakes.

...Unless I'm playing her, which is pretty common because, y'know, I main her. : ^)
